data.title: UX meeting agenda 2 November 2016
data.body:
- Discuss designs for managing viewlets

Anything else?

data.title: Add auto-hide output (feature suggestion)
data.body:
Similar to VS Studio, very annoying to click "close output" after every code/task run.

It should hide when mouse hovers over code, or at least when click code (faster than clicking little close button in the corner)

data.title: Add support for code extract into variable and method
VSCode busy building symbols and stops the auto complete from working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Hello, I've been having issues with using an extension that builds symbols. I can replicate the issue with both the official C++ and Python extensions.

Some info about the project:

- It's large (10k+ files)
- It's mostly on cpp and python, but there's a wide variety of file types
- I've added loads of file extensions to be ignored (not sure if this affects which files are processed)

Regardless of extension, the auto complete is stuck on `Loading...` most of the time, I imagine that is because the symbols are being built? The symbols also seem to be lost on editor change, resulting in another ~30sec symbol building.

However **Reloading the window** from the command prompt actually refreshes all the symbols and auto complete and builds/loads them in nearly instantly.. until the editor is changed again.

I am not sure whether this is an extension specific issue, however getting exactly the same problem with 2 completely different extension leads me to believe that there could be a deeper problem in VSCode.

I'll provide any additional info you want if I can.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Load very large project (the one Im working on is 10k+ files)
2. Need an extension that builds symbols for the language, the problem does not exist if symbols are not being built.
3. Play around with the files and editors, the auto complete will stop working and most of the time will be spent building symbols.

data.title: Open VS Code file / folder from command line in the same window in a new tab in macOS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6

I can open Visual Studio Code from cli by using `open -a Visual\ Studio\ Code` + file/folder name.

This however always opens the file/folder in a new window. Since I like to run VS Code in full screen, this is very annoying for me. Is it possible to make a cli that will open files in the same VS Code window in a new tab?

Thank you.

data.title: All debug adapters: support `evaluateName` attribute for Variables
data.body:
If a Variable has an `evaluateName` attribute, the VS Code debugger UI will use this instead of creating an evaluatable expression by using some heuristics.
All debug adapters should support this mechanism so that VS Code can drop the heuristic.

data.title: Debug protocol additions for November
data.body:
Planned for November:
- [x] Allow multiline eval results in debug console Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/pull/83
- [x] Allow debug adapters to customize the behavior of the 'restart' button #14189
- [x] Add reverse continue for TimeTravel Debugging feature #13705
- [x] Support a variablesReference in OutputEvent Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/79
- [x] Support more flexible handling of exceptions Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/64
- [x] formatting hints Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/84

Planned for December:
- [ ] Allow passing back a `path` AND a `sourceReference` Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/60

Rejected:
- [x] Add ability to change the value of expressions Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/85

Backlog:
- [ ] Protocol support for "blackbox script"/"Just my code" #14728

/cc @gregg-miskelly @jacdavis @kieferrm @egamma @roblourens @richardstanton

data.title: C# syntax error hints disappear after a few seconds
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6 (15G1108

C# syntax error hint disappears after a few seconds.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. make a C# file
2. install C# plugin (1.4.1)
3. write a simple C# class
4. intentionally cause a syntax error.
5. observe red hints on the syntax error.
6. wait a couple of seconds, error hints disappear.

I expect this to be a VSCode issue instead of OmniSharp, since the syntax hints did show up correctly, only to disappear in a couple of seconds.

data.title: No response for 'evaluate' request when program is running
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

```javascript
var t = 5;
debugger;
```

1. Once you hit the breakpoint add `t` to a watch expression -> it is nicely evaluated
2. Continue the program -> notice how `t` does not update to `not available`. This is due to the fact that evalute request is not sending a response
3. I would expect the evalute to always give a response no matter the state of the program

data.title: Setting to turn off ALL popups?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Do any programming in JavaScript

- - -

VS Code is constantly popping up tips etc around the caret. My personal experience is that they are more of a hindrance than a help 99% of the time. I am CONSTANTLY hitting escape to get rid of them so I can see my code.

Is there an option to have them triggered by a shortcut key rather than automatically as I type? This is the first editor I've come across where there's no clear way to do that.

Generally I really love VS Code, but this one feature makes it feel like I'm fighting the editor.

I've already got

    "editor.quickSuggestions": false,

but it hasn't helped.

Thanks

data.title: Clean file changes line endings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win 7 sp1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a file that has LF endings
2. Do some change.
3. Decide you want to revert the file.
4.  Click on the branching icon (git) and right click then clean the file

Results

The file is changed to CRLF line endings.

Expected

The file keeps the existing line ending.

data.title: Provide an option to insert a final newline (fixes #1666)
data.body:
My attempt to introduce a new save participant for adding a final new line at the end of the file unless:
* the file does not contain more than one line
* the last line is already whitespace

The only corner case I was not sure how to solve is that the cursor jumps to the last line when you save while you are on the last character of the previous line.

/cc @alexandrudima

Steps to Reproduce:

1. push Alt+Shift+f for auto format, and tabs are inserted instead of spaces. 

Configuration has not change so this is all i have in form of reproduction. Pushing Tab inserts the correct number of spaces as configured.

data.title: Git view bar and side bar does not clear when folder is changed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a git enabled project, make some changes
2. Open another git enabled project on top of the current one, sidebar and view bar still displays git status and uncommitted changes of previous project.

data.title: JavaScript Intellisense doesn't autocomplete Element.value property
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
 
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a JavaScript file
2. Attempt to autocomplete an element e.g. through 
```JavaScript
let el =  document.getElementbyId("id")
el.value  // <-- This doesn't autocomplete, however the following does:
el.nodeValue // autocompletes

data.title: in-product release notes blank after editor group changes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1, 1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10, OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a least two editor groups and put the in-product release notes in a right or lower editor group.
2. Close the left or top editor group.

The in-product release notes become blank. Clicking the editor or scrolling has no effect.  Double-clicking the tab heading refreshes the release notes.

It doesn't repro if the release notes are left or above the closing editor group.

data.title: OPEN EDITORS collapse triangle doesn't collapse file list
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.1, 1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open several files in an editor group
2. OPEN EDITORS will show a collapse triangle for each editor group (LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT)
3. Click on the triangle

The editor group list is not collapsed.  All other triangles in the Explorer collapse the list.

data.title: Don't stop tabdrop propagation. Fixes issue #12623.
data.body: The bug seemed to be caused by the fact that the tab's DROP event was stopping propagation.  I don't know why it was doing this, because it stopped the tab container receiving the DROP event, which needs to happen for it to remove the "scroll" class.

data.title: Tooltip text wrapping cuts words, has scroll bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1 (and insiders as well)
- OS Version: linux/win

See old tooltip (1.4, top) vs new tooltip (1.6.1, bottom)

![Tooltips](http://i.imgur.com/TQwgfkt.png)

I have a few problems with this tooltip:
1. The wrapping seems to be break-word, making some symbols hard to read.
2. There is a horizontal scrollbar inside the tooltip (Could editor.fontSize affect this?)
3. The tooltip is not stable on mouse move out/over repeatedly. It changes width and wrapping.

Some subjective observations as well:
- Was the max-width reduced?
- I think the contrast is better with the darker background.

data.title: Open the README for extension while/after installation
data.body:
Once the user finds an extension in the extension viewlet, clicks on install, it would be nice to have the Extension page (with the readme etc) open up while the extension installs.
At present, this comes up only if the extension list item is selected.
Clicking on the "Install" button should trigger the same action

data.title: Allowfor "shellArgs" in Windows integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to change `terminal.integrated.shell.windows` to pass additional parameters like variable expansion flag.
2. terminal fails with exit code 1

There is no current way to passadditional parameters to theWindows shell, it would be useful for configuration scripts and flags passed to the terminal, os other options passed to custom terminals.
In fact, theintegrated terminaldon't work with anythingother than powershell and cmd.

data.title: Rubber band scrolling for MacOS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature request.

Native Mac apps rubber band when reaching the end of scrolling. It's one of the best features of macOS UI. But VSC does not rubber band when scrolling to the end of a document.

VSC should do native rubber banding when scrolling to top and bottom of a document on macOS.

data.title: Switching tabs loses scroll position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:27:10.246Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0
- Extensions: DotJoshJohnson.xml-1.6.0, Shan.code-settings-sync-2.3.5, donjayamanne.python-0.5.0, groksrc.haml-0.0.2, lukehoban.Go-0.6.47, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1, rebornix.Ruby-0.10.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open several files (my tests were all C# / .cs files)
2. Click on some line in a file
3. Scroll, in the that same file, do another location
4. Click another tab
5. Click on tab of the original file -- note that the window is positioned to the cursor (the line you clicked) and not the last scroll position
